overview_metadata.overview_subtitle: Cross-Sections of Rectangular Prisms and Pyramids
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students model and describe two-dimensional cross-sections that result from slicing a cube, a right rectangular prism, and a rectangular pyramid that is not a cube. They compare the two-dimensional cross-sections of right rectangular pyramids and right rectangular prisms.

overview_item_data_items: I can describe the two-dimensional figures that result from slicing a right rectangular prism in a particular direction.
I can describe the two-dimensional figures that result from slicing a right rectangular pyramid in a particular direction.
I can compare the two-dimensional cross-sections of right rectangular prisms and right rectangular pyramids.
The two-dimensional figure formed by intersecting a plane and a solid is a cross-section of the solid.
A right rectangular prism has bases and lateral faces that are rectangles.
A right rectangular pyramid has a rectangular base and four triangular lateral faces, with the height perpendicular to the base.

The possible cross-sections formed by slicing any right rectangular prism with a plane are a square, a rectangle that is not a square, a triangle, a pentagon, a hexagon, and a parallelogram that is not a rectangle.
The possible cross-sections formed by slicing any right rectangular pyramid by a plane are a triangle, a rectangle that is not a square, and a trapezoid.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: One Square, Two Cuts, Three Shapes
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students describe two cuts on a square to create three shapes.

Students slice clay cubes to create cross-sectional shapes. 
Materials: Clay, dental floss or thin wire
Students create a graphic organizer of the cross-sections of a cube.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Cross-Sections of a Right Rectangular Prism
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students create a graphic organizer of the cross-sections of a right rectangular prism.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Cross-Sections of a Right Rectangular Pyramid
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio:
Students create a graphic organizer of the cross-sections of a right rectangular pyramid. 
Materials: Clay, dental floss or thin wire

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: They Are All Right . . . Rectangular Prisms or Pyramids
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students compare cross-sections of right rectangular prisms and right rectangular prisms.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
